column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////Met a large group of friends here for a birthday celebration. Inside was very cool
column2: with lots of interesting decor to look at. I started off with the polyphonic gin & tonic
column3: which was surprisingly delicious. Very lightly sweet
column4: not too harsh as I was expecting. For an appetizer I had the cilantro edamame hummus
column5: which was very good. I also tried the pork belly bao buns
column6: which were good. For my main course I had vegi out maki
column7: which was good and surprisingly filling. We debated on desserts as they sell large ice cream sandwiches in fun flavors
column8: but ultimately we were too full. Great spot
